decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through discard effects like Thoughtseize and Waste Not, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and card advantage. The deck also utilizes a combination of win conditions such as Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Hive of the Eye Tyrant to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to grind out the opponent through attrition and resource denial, eventually overpowering them with powerful late-game threats.

This deck revolves around utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn's powerful ability to consistently draw cards and gain card advantage, leading to a control-based strategy. The deck includes a variety of spells and creatures with different mana costs and colors to ensure maximum value when Niv-Mizzet Reborn enters the battlefield. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells, ramp cards, and powerful companions like Yorion, Sky Nomad to provide additional value and flexibility in different matchups. Ultimately, the goal is to control the game with a diverse array of cards and out-value opponents to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with aggressive artifact creatures and then using various spells and abilities to enhance their power and deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes a variety of artifacts and artifact synergies to overwhelm the opponent and maintain control of the battlefield. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional layer of strategy and versatility to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to utilize artifact creatures and powerful spells to quickly defeat the opponent in a fast-paced fashion.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck includes a mix of cheap spells, card draw, and graveyard manipulation to consistently bring back the Phoenix and put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Ashiok, Dream Render and Spell Pierce helps to control the opponent's resources while maintaining a fast pace. This deck aims to outpace opponents with efficient spells and powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on dealing quick and efficient damage to the opponent through a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on with cheap and hasty creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also having the ability to finish off the opponent with direct damage spells like Wizard's Lightning and Play with Fire. The deck also includes protection spells like Blossoming Defense to keep key creatures alive and maintain board presence.
